channel.title: BCD-watch: Changes Report (weekly)
channel.description: A feed that summarizes changes to BCD weekly

item.title: BCD Changes Report, Mon Jun 16 2025
item.description: Weekly summary of new changes in BCD data
item.content:encoded:
Summary of BCD changes from Monday, 9 June 2025 through Monday, 16 June 2025ğŸ”—

Browser Support Changes: +6, -0

Support increases (6)

CSS

  1. css â at-rules â keyframes â named_range_keyframes
    Added to Safari  â  2 of 3 engines
  2. css â types â color â contrast-color
    Added to Safari  â  1 of 3 engines
  3. css â types â sibling-count
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  4. css â types â sibling-index
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

HTTP

  1. http â headers â Integrity-Policy
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  2. http â headers â Integrity-Policy-Report-Only
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

BCD Metadata Changes: 82

Show all 82 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

Backfilled entries (39)

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Friday, 6 June 2025, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old. Typically, these are cases of support information being updated long after the support actually landed in a browser, but nobody ever updated the BCD entry.

HTTP

  1. http â headers â Permissions-Policy
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  2. http â headers â Feature-Policy
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  3. http â headers â Feature-Policy â accelerometer
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  11. http â headers â Feature-Policy â cross-origin-isolated
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

New entries (43)

The entries in this section were not found in BCD on Friday, 6 June 2025, but are now present. These usually do not have any support information attached to them, and often have no corresponding MDN page. Sometimes, entries that appear here also appear in the next section (â€œRemoved BCD entriesâ€) because of a Working Group deciding on a rename.

item.title: BCD Changes Report, Mon Jun 09 2025
item.description: Weekly summary of new changes in BCD data
item.content:encoded:
Summary of BCD changes from Monday, 2 June 2025 through Monday, 9 June 2025ğŸ”—

Browser Support Changes: +3, -0

Support increases (3)

WEBDRIVER

  1. webdriver â bidi â browsingContext â navigationCommitted_event
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines
  2. webdriver â bidi â browsingContext â historyUpdated_event
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines

WEBEXTENSIONS

  1. webextensions â api â cookies â sameSiteStatus â unspecified
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines

BCD Metadata Changes: 15

Show all 15 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

Backfilled entries (9)

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Friday, 30 May 2025, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old. Typically, these are cases of support information being updated long after the support actually landed in a browser, but nobody ever updated the BCD entry.

API

  1. api â RTCRtpScriptTransform
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  3 of 3 engines
  2. api â GPUCommandEncoder â copyBufferToBuffer â offset_and_size_parameter_optional
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  3. api â GPUDevice â createBindGroup â descriptor_entries_option_accepts_GPUTextureView_resource
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  4. api â ProgressEvent â ProgressEvent â loaded_total_options_accept_double
    Backfilled for Firefox  â  3 of 3 engines

CSS

  1. css â properties â clip-path â is_animatable
    Backfilled for Safari  â  3 of 3 engines
  2. css â properties â rx
    Backfilled for Safari  â  3 of 3 engines
  3. css â properties â ry
    Backfilled for Safari  â  3 of 3 engines
  4. css â selectors â marker â animation_and_transition_support
    Backfilled for Safari  â  3 of 3 engines
  5. css â properties â view-transition-name â match-element
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

New entries (5)

The entries in this section were not found in BCD on Friday, 30 May 2025, but are now present. These usually do not have any support information attached to them, and often have no corresponding MDN page. Sometimes, entries that appear here also appear in the next section (â€œRemoved BCD entriesâ€) because of a Working Group deciding on a rename.

API

  1. api â GPUCommandEncoder â copyBufferToBuffer â offset_and_size_parameter_optional
  2. api â GPUDevice â createBindGroup â descriptor_entries_option_accepts_GPUTextureView_resource
  3. api â ProgressEvent â ProgressEvent â loaded_total_options_accept_double

CSS

  1. css â properties â view-transition-name â match-element

WEBDRIVER

  1. webdriver â bidi â browsingContext â historyUpdated_event

Removed entries (1)

The entries in this section were found in BCD on Friday, 30 May 2025, but are no longer present. The reasons for this removal can be anything from an experimental proposal that was never supported to a property or value being renamed to something else.

SVG

  1. svg â elements â discard
  • Previous report: Monday, 2 June 2025

BCD Watch: A service of

Subscribe: RSS â€¢Â Atom â€¢Â JSON

This report was generated by diffing v6.0.19 (Friday, 30 May 2025) and v6.0.21 (Friday, 6 June 2025)

BCD Metadata Changes: 37

Show all 37 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

Backfilled entries (15)

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Friday, 23 May 2025, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old. Typically, these are cases of support information being updated long after the support actually landed in a browser, but nobody ever updated the BCD entry.

  1. api â FileSystemWritableFileStream

    Backfilled for Safari  â  3 of 3 engines

New entries (22)

The entries in this section were not found in BCD on Friday, 23 May 2025, but are now present. These usually do not have any support information attached to them, and often have no corresponding MDN page. Sometimes, entries that appear here also appear in the next section (â€œRemoved BCD entriesâ€) because of a Working Group deciding on a rename.

Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

BCD Metadata Changes: 65

Show all 65 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Friday, 9 May 2025, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old.
